customData.content: Abdominal ultrasound showed a fluid collection with septations adjacent to the spleen.

imaging.finding: Fluid collection with septations adjacent to the spleen
imaging.impression: Fluid collection with septations adjacent to the spleen

customData.content: CT of the abdomen and pelvis showed a complex cystic lesion in the left upper quadrant, measuring 7.6 x 11.7 cm, reported as a lymphangioma. Patient had no associated symptoms.

imaging.finding: Complex cystic lesion measuring 7.6 x 11.7 cm

customData.content: Physical exam unremarkable. No therapeutic intervention was initiated. Follow-up CT scan scheduled in six months. CT Abdomen/Pelvis With IV and Oral Contrast: Left-sided subdiaphragmatic cystic lesion measuring 7.6 cm in transverse dimension noted below the diaphragm between the liver and the spleen.

imaging.finding: Left-sided subdiaphragmatic cystic lesion measuring 7.6 cm in transverse dimension noted below the diaphragm between the liver and the spleen.

customData.content: Patient reported feeling pressure and a pulling sensation on the left side of her abdomen, rated as 4/10 for pain. Repeat CT scan showed the cystic lesion had almost doubled in size, now measuring 11 x 22 cm, with extension into the hepatorenal space.

HPI.summary: Patient reported feeling pressure and a pulling sensation on the left side of her abdomen, rated as 4/10 for pain.

imaging.finding: Cystic lesion had almost doubled in size, now measuring 11 x 22 cm, with extension into the hepatorenal space.

customData.content: Ultrasound-guided aspiration revealed 33 mL of clear yellow fluid, which was sent to pathology and revealed no evidence of malignant cells.
MRI demonstrated a large T2 hyperintense cystic mass extending from the spleen on the left to the left hemipelvis, along with enhancing septations.

imaging.finding: Large T2 hyperintense cystic mass extending from the spleen on the left to the left hemipelvis, along with enhancing septations.

data.content: Progression from fluid collection adjacent to the spleen to a complex cystic lesion (7.6 x 11.7 cm) reported as a lymphangioma on CT scan. No associated symptoms reported.
No therapeutic intervention initiated. Follow-up CT scan scheduled in six months. Cystic lesion remains stable at 7.6 cm.

Cystic lesion increased in size. Patient reported feeling pressure and a pulling sensation on the left side of her abdomen, rated as 4/10 for pain. Cystic lesion almost doubled in size, now measuring 11 x 22 cm, with extension into the hepatorenal space.
Ultrasound-guided aspiration performed, revealing 33 mL of clear yellow fluid. Pathology showed no evidence of malignant cells.
MRI demonstrated a large T2 hyperintense cystic mass extending from the spleen on the left to the left hemipelvis, along with enhancing septations.
Patient received doxycycline sclerotherapy over eight months. Post-sclerotherapy ultrasound performed.
